text: Louis Brown Johnson (September 22, 1934 - September 30, 2020) was an American baseball player. He was born in Lexington, Kentucky. In 1965, he became a World Series champion. His career lasted between 1960 to 1969. Johnson played for the Chicago Cubs, Los Angeles Angels, Milwaukee Braves, Los Angeles Dodgers, Cleveland Indians and California Angels. Johnson died on September 30, 2020 in Los Angeles, just one week after his 86th birthday. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Chicago Cubs players Category:Los Angeles Angels players Category:Milwaukee Braves players Category:Los Angeles Dodgers players Category:Cleveland Indians players Category:California Angels players Category:Sportspeople from Kentucky Category:People from Lexington, Kentucky
title: Lou Johnson
